articles.description: On Sept. 25, Roseburg Forest Products (RFP) announced it had discontinued operations at its hardwood plywood facility in Dillard, leading to layoffs for more than 100 employees.
articles.title: RFP Dillard plywood layoffs settlements come to a close

articles.description: As the year comes to a close, the Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT) is looking forward to a year of new and ongoing projects intended to make roads safer for motorists and pedestrians alike.
articles.title: ODOT lays out upcoming projects to continue into new year

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review

articles.title: Sutherlin Timber Town Toy Land Electric Light Parade returns for 33rd year

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Coastal anglers will be able to keep more lingcod in 2026, while Oregon’s general marine bag limit for rockfish and other nearshore species will remain at four fish per day.
articles.title: Oregon anglers get a bigger lingcod limit in 2026 per ODFW Commission

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Police are investigating an early-morning ATM theft at Rogue Credit Union on NW Garden Valley Blvd. Officers found a damaged ATM and a stolen pickup left running at the scene. Two suspects fled in a white SUV. The investigation is ongoing.
articles.title: Cash Stolen After ATM Damaged at Rogue Credit Union in Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Colorcraft Paint, located next to the former Waldron’s Outdoor Sports on Garden Valley Blvd, has closed after serving the Roseburg community for 70 years. The longtime local business thanked the community as it marked the end of an era.
articles.title: LOCAL BUSINESS CLOSURE – COLORCRAFT PAINT

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office will conduct enhanced DUII patrols from December 10 through January 1 as part of the Drive Sober or Get Pulled Over campaign, focusing on removing impaired drivers from local roadways during the holiday season.
articles.title: SHERIFF’S OFFICE TO PARTICIPATE IN ENHANCED DUII PATROLS THIS HOLIDAY SEASON

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Wildlife Safari’s Wild Lights brings holiday magic to Winston with illuminated paths, animal encounters, hot cocoa, Santa visits, and the popular Candy Cane Caboose. With one weekend left, families still have time to enjoy this seasonal tradition.
articles.title: WILDLIFE SAFARI’S WILD LIGHTS BRINGS HOLIDAY MAGIC TO WINSTON

articles.title: December 22, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Sutherlin’s Timber Town Toy Land Electric Light Parade featured 79 vehicles, raised $7,000 in sponsorships, and paid out all prize money across multiple categories while reflecting on nearly two decades of community tradition.
articles.title: Sutherlin Timber Town Toy Land Electric Light Parade Raises $7,000, Honors 2025 Winners

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Recent storms have damaged trails and recreation areas across Oregon State Forests. Downed trees, erosion, and hazardous conditions are being reported as crews and volunteers work to assess and repair impacts. Visitors are urged to use caution this winter.
articles.title: Storms Damage Trails and Recreation Areas Across Oregon State Forests

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A cherished chapter in Roseburg dining is ending as Fun Cuisine prepares to leave the historic Parrott House due to the property being sold. While the location is closing, the business will continue catering and plans to reopen soon as a new Italian bistro.
articles.title: A Heartfelt Goodbye To Parrott House And A New Beginning For Fun Cuisine

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Roseburg Schools is inviting community members to join a new Community Facilities Advisory Committee. This group will help assess the condition of aging school buildings and explore long-term facility needs.
articles.title: Roseburg Schools calls on community for facilities committee input
